situation: E was hesitant to join her peers in outdoor games, fearing she wouldn't understand the rules quickly enough.
action: The teacher aide paired E with a buddy who explained the games one step at a time. Visual aids with simplified instructions were also provided to help E grasp the rules at her own pace.
effect: E gradually joined her peers, observing and participating in the games. Having support from a buddy and visual aids reduced her anxiety, leading to more successful social interactions and participation in playtime activities.
topic: Social Interaction Challenges - Difficulties with peer interactions, challanges during
